//notes: oral form of vancomycin is not normally absorbed by the body and only works in the intenstines
dosage is noted in most cases to the 4 times a day, making one dose last ~6 hours, not 12
serious side effects include hearing loss and ears ringing, as well as nausea
having low chance of curing an infection is not at all how narrow-spectrum antibiotics work, but for now, this is the best we can do
description: A gelatin capsule, blue cap over a salmon-colored body, with a popular narrow-spectrum antibiotic; product of Akorn.  On one of the sides,  "742" is imprinted, along with "250 mg", indicating the dosage; the other side is without an imprint.  Has a low chance to stifle or cure bacterial infections.  One dose lasts 12 hours.
//variants: sold commercially as Vancomycin Hydrochloride, including by Akorn

description: A gelatin capsule, gray cap over a yellow body, with a broad-spectrum antibiotic; product of Actavis.  Around the cap,  "MINOCYCLINE 100" is imprinted, indicating the dosage; on the body, "DAN 5695".  It is very effective against bacterial infection, boosting your chances of recovery significantly.  One dose lasts 12 hours.
//variants: appears to be sold as Minocycline commercially by Actavis
other brand names include Dynacin, Minocin, Minocin PAC, Minolira, Solodyn, Ximino, Vectrin, Myrac

description: A gelatin capsule, blue cap over an off-white body, with a powerful antifungal drug; product of Lupin.  Around the cap, "NL771" is imprinted; on the body, "250", indicating the dosage.  It is very effective against fungal infections, boosting your chances of recovery significantly.  One dose lasts 12 hours.
//variants: commerically sold by Valeant(?) as Ancobon
Valeant has for a long time maintained a monopoly on this drug, making it ridiculously-expensive
//price: we take the cheapest possible price (30 [5 × 6] capsules), which is still $32.19 (as of Jan 2024)
//price_postapoc: high barter price per pill due to very limited availability even prior to Cataclysm

description: A gelatin capsule, light-green cap over a yellowish-white body, with a prescription-grade antidepressant; product of Eli Lilly.  On both the body and the cap, "Lilly 3105" is imprinted.  It offsets the mood negatives of a depression.  It has a small potential for forming a habit.
//variants: other brand names include Sarafem, Rapiflux, Selfemra
//container: a common package appears to be 2 × 14-pill blister pack
//price: price for a 20 mg formulation in 30-capsule bottle
